document_data.name: Gorse
document_data.refs2e: {{Cite dragon/180/The Dragon's Bestiary: Three peculiar beasts for all AD&D campaigns|71-72}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Gorse''' were tiny [[Fey|faeries]] that lived in their namesake plant.
document_data.Description: Gorse faeries were only {{SI|3|in|c|long=yes}} tall, similar in proportion and appearance to a human child, but possessing pointed ears and butterfly-like wings. They typically wore simple clothing that was green or yellow in color.
document_data.Abilities: Gorse, like other fey, could naturally cast a few spells. Once a day, a gorse could cast ''[[exterminate]]'', ''[[sprout]]'', ''[[distract]]'', and ''[[mirror image]]''. One in ten gorse could also cast ''[[goodberry]]'' and ''[[spike growth]]'' once per day.
document_data.Personality: Gorse were shy and unobtrusive fey.
document_data.Combat:
Gorse fought to protect themselves and their homes, using minute bows, spears, and swords. About 10% of their arrows were coated with a [[poison]] that caused mild confusion.

Gorse typically used the spell ''exterminate'' to deal with enemies that, while mere pests to larger creatures, were threats to the tiny faeries.

Society.Diet: Gorse were a herbivorous species of fey.
Society.Languages: Gorse had their own language, and were also able to speak the languages of [[sprite]]s and [[pixie]]s.
Society.Relationships:
Gorse were wary of "big folk", but were protective of those who did them favors, such as [[druid]]s or [[elves]] who defeated menacing beasts or fought wildfires. If such as ally was nearby, it was not unusual for a tribe to send a few members to accompany them for the duration of their visit. They could also be persuaded to deal with forest-dwellers that brought gifts of bread, fresh fruit, or milk.

Gorse were a [[favored monster]] of the [[Seldarine]] [[deities]] [[Aerdrie Faenya]], [[Erevan Ilesere]], and [[Hanali Celanil]].

document_data.Trivia: * A gorse was one of the forms that a caster of the spell ''[[faerie form]]'' could assume.
